intro: Dalechampia catatii, commonly known as the catatonic dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
